intro: Xylopia orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco xylopia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, woody stems and simple, alternate leaves. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a globose berry that contains several seeds, and the plant is often found in humid lowland forests.
